RED XMAS: JINGLE HELL! is a 48-page, perfect-bound comic book concluding the series critics call: 
From ELF to Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer to "The Hanakkuh Song"... the holiday special is a staple of nearly all media.
We've set out to create one for comics. 
Here's the pitch:
"When Mrs. Claus dies in a tragic toy accident, Santa sets out to make all those little brats pay. Now, a Santa-skeptic FBI agent must team up with her wannabe-elf ex-husband to save their son--and Christmas!"
In addition to the super-sized 40-page main story, the book includes:
Kickstarter-exclusive bonus material
FREE U.S. SHIPPING!
Digital making-of material and theme song
Higher tier backers get:
Sketch cards
Limited edition commissions by Fabio Ramacci
A cameo in the book as a Mall Santa or evil troll
When Mrs. Claus dies in a tragic toy accident...
Santa loses his s#!t on the town of Christmas, Vermont...
And while FBI agent Ellie Tewskberry tries--and fails--to bring him down...

Her son, Byron, runs away to the North Pole to find his dad, a wannabe elf who left the family years ago. Instead, Byron finds trouble:
Desperate to find her son, Ellie infiltrates A.S.S.--The American Santa Society--the national Union for Mall Santas. Soon, she finds herself fighting an age-old war alongside some... colorful allies.
But Santa escapes justice again. And just when all seems lost, Ellie's estranged husband re-appears... 
And now...

Still not sure?
Try before you buy!
Wanna download the first issue free?
WHY, JUST CLICK HERE!
Or click this obnoxious yellow button:
Miss Any of Our Previous RED XMAS Campaigns?
Catch up with our 72-page RED XMAS: TRIPLE PLAY, reprinting our NEARLY SOLD OUT first three issues. This is just the meat and bun, hon--no bonus features in this burger.
(Gotta have those extras? Our BLIND BOX tier includes the 64-page RED XMAS: O HOLY CRAP! (Issues 1 & 2) and the 40-page RED XMAS: SILENT, BUT DEADLY, NIGHT (Issue 3)--plus a bunch of other surprises.
Variants
Our standard cover by Fabio Ramacci and Ilaria Chiocca took our breath away. But we know you collectors like your variants.
First up is our "Lady and the Tramp" variant by colorist Emilio Pilliu, which depicts the, uh, reunion of Ellie and her husband, Witherspoon.  
Uh, careful, Ellie. That sauce is hot.
Next up is an exclusive variant by artist Gian Carlo Bernal of Crescent City Monsters fame. If you've read CCM, you know this guy can draw!
The Sketch Cards
At the $100 level, Fabio will draw you an exclusive sketch of a character from RED XMAS on a size A5 card. Here are some of the awesome cards he whipped up last year:
COMMISSIONS!
Sketch card not big enough for ya? Snag a one-of-a-kind commission featuring a RED XMAS character from Fabio Ramacci in standard comic board size. 
If you want something more complicated than a couple of characters from RED XMAS, drop us a line and we can totally work it out (fair warning: there may be an additional fee, depending on what you want). Last year, Fabio rocked this one for a backer:
Frieda and Santa battle some creatures that are totally not Ewoks.
The Process Junkie Edition
Available as an add-on to any print tier: a B&W print version of some of the digital process rewards included in all tiers. The full script printed alongside the layouts, with some of the 'naked' inks to boot, so you can see how a book like RED XMAS comes together. 70-pages minimum (likely more), extremely limited edition, hand-numbered and signed by Clay. 
Mock-up only. Final cover TBD.
Adding this book to any print tier = Easy
1) Click "Manage Your Pledge" at the top right of our page
 2) Click "Change My Pledge"
 3) Add $20 to your existing tier
 4) Click "Continue"
 5) Confirm changes
 6) Drop us a comment that says "Process Junkie!"

Last year's book, RED XMAS: SILENT, BUT DEADLY, NIGHT!, came out great.
Readers loved it... 
In fact, the book was such a hit, we almost sold out of the entire print run this year!
This issue, Santa's going down. Ready to join the fight?
Or, just listen to these fine people of exquisite taste: 
FRIED Comics is a proud purveyor of offbeat, irreverent pulp fiction since 2013, and a labor of love for Clay Adams and Alexandre O. Philippe.
So far, we have six successful Kickstarters under our belts. (And between us we have a lot of belts. ) So, we're stoked to return to the scene of the crime.

Clay Adams is a writer and filmmaker who's funded six projects on Kickstarter with FRIED Comics. His directorial debut, THE BOY SCOUT, was nominated for Best Short at the Golden Egg Film Festival in Los Angeles, and his feature script, THE ECLIPSE, placed second in the horror category of the FADEIn Awards. He has written and directed for television and holds a BFA in Dramatic Writing from NYU. When Clay first met Alexandre, he thought, "My, what a sophisticated European." Boy, was he wrong!

Film nerd/director Alexandre's most recent movie is 78/52, an acclaimed documentary about the shower scene in Psycho, playing theaters now. He holds a Masters Degree in Dramatic Writing from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts and has written and directed numerous award-winning films and documentaries, including THE PEOPLE vs. GEORGE LUCAS, DOC OF THE DEAD, and THE LIFE AND TIMES OF PAUL THE PSYCHIC OCTOPUS. When Alexandre first met Clay, he thought, "My, what a stupid American." Boy, was he right!
Fabio comes to us from Rome, Italy, where he has published with Star Comics and Sergio Bonelli Editore. He recently contributed to the horror anthology Modern Dread, which was successfully funded on Kickstarter. Our resident Italian Stallion likes alt rock and (we assume) makes a great cappuccino, but all indications are that he ain't that Fabio.
Ilaria is an Italian comic artist and colorist. She has published two euro-manga style books with Kasaobake as co-author and co-artist; she's done a bunch of covers as a digital painter and now she's working as a colorist for many secret projects worldwide - no joke!
Ryan is a writer, artist, and alum of the The Comics Experience School. He successfully Kickstarted his debut comic, SUNMAKER, and contributed art to the ComixTribe column 'The Proving Grounds.'  He loves Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, ninjas, teens, mutants and turtles.
In the grand tradition of failing upwards, Mick has turned not bathing into a signature look and doodling into a paying gig. Trophy husband/father by day and night, the little moments here and there are devoted to the doodling. Having successfully funded a Kickstarter of his own (ROVERS), and with books to be published next year, Mick is in danger of enough success he might have to shower again.
Ugh. Just... ugh.
 But enough about us. You wanna see...
The Package
We've gotten our fair share of comics that arrived mangled by the mail carrier.
You pay premium prices on Kickstarter, and you deserve better. That's why we've started using Gemini Comic Mailers:
These babies are sturdy. They require a little more money, a little more time (and a lot more tape!) but it's worth it to make sure your comics arrive in pristine condition.
And if somehow your comic still gets roughed up?
Frieda will replace it free of charge. 
Why Kickstarter?
We're digging deep into our pockets to pay for the preview and put aside money for the printing. Now we're asking for your help in covering production costs. We believe in paying our artists a fair wage, and hiring collaborators of this quality isn't cheap. 
By supporting this project, you're joining us as producers. In return, you'll receive all Kickstarter-exclusive perks, credit in the book, behind-the-scenes "making-of" material, and early access to the finished story.   
Fair enough. Where will all the money go?
First, we'll put it in a big pile and dive in, Scrooge McDuck-style.
Then we'll:
Pay Kickstarter taxes and fees
Pay our artists a fair page rate
Print the book and ship it to you
If we're fortunate enough to raise more than our goal, we'll use that money towards production of the RED XMAS collected edition. 
Hoo-ray! Win-win.
Our Evil Plan:
The Kickstarter Campaign: 12 Days-ish (Dec 4th-Dec 18th)
Kickstarter Funds Released: ~Jan 1
Digital Rewards Released: April
Book Goes to Printer: April
Book Printed and shipped to Fried Diner ~Apr 30
"$#it happens" buffer - 1 month (~May 31)
Frieda and our sweatshop workers (AKA Frieda's kids) pack and ship - (~June 1-June 30)
Expected delivery to US backers - 2 Weeks (Early July)
Expected delivery for International Backers - 4 Weeks (late July)
Thanks, Hon!
We're not asking for a million dollars.
We just want to give you some holiday cheer, put a cool book in your hand, and entertain you for a bit.
So find a pledge level you like and pre-order. We'll make more comics.
And, as always, if you leave a comment on our Kickstarter page that says, "Frieda sent me," we'll send you an extra-special gift.
Oh! And finally:
We heard somewhere that Kickstarter campaigns do better when they have pictures of cats on the page. So, here's a picture of Clay's cat:
"I said, Pinot Noir! Get this out of my face."
Thanks for supporting! And remember...

campaign.story:
Cover of the Graphic Novel
It's Alive...Again! We're back with the Second Volume of Frankenstein for Mayor. Finishing the second volume allows us to collect both of the volumes in to the complete 150 page graphic novel. 
In the first volume, Frankenstein was brought back from the dead a second time. He's introduced to the modern world, including his own legacy. He's also introduced to the town known as Transylvania that's become steeply divided between witches, werewolves, and vampires. The Count of the region and town is his former arch-rival, Dracula. The werewolves have recently lost their candidate in the first ever election held in the town.  They've resurrected Frankenstein in hopes of adopting him as the next candidate to take on Dracula in the election. After seeing the oppression and suffering of the werewolf people, especially the werewolf refugees, by the vampire upper class, Frankenstein reluctantly agrees. 
In the second volume, Frankenstein must learn how to win an election against a heavily favored incumbent. Frank is joined by his long time friend, Mary Shelly, former werewolf police officer, Gustav, and head priestess of the witch's coven, Indigo. Together they have to uncover evidence of Dracula's past crimes to release them to the public. Here's a preview of what's to come:
Cover of Volume Two
PURPOSE
The books are completed, but we need your help to getting books printed. We print through IngramSpark and are hoping to order one hundred copies of the book to sell at conventions and to reward you with. 
REWARDS
We're offering some amazing rewards including pin-ups from artists that previously worked with Disposable Fiction Comics such as David Newbold and Dan Lauer. 
Pin up by David Newbold and Chris Allen
Pin up by Dan Lauer and Chris Allen
Pin up by Reinaldo Contreras and Chris Allen
Get your own Election Pins. Show your support for your candidate with an election pin and bumper sticker for either Frankenstein or Dracula.
Can't decide, choose both sides and receive all four and a free comic! Tales of Terror includes four horrifying tales from Disposable Fiction's previous anthology series. 
Cover of Tales of Terror from Disposable Fiction Comics
For the final reward, not only will you receive all the rewards offered so far, but this is your chance to get drawn into the world, literally. Send us a picture and Reinaldo will draw you or a person of your choice in to the pin up. A truly one of a kind reward.
You can become Dracula's next victim
WHO WE ARE
Jack Wallace is an Eisner Nominated writer from Columbus. He's the creator behind Disposable Fiction Comics, a webcomic of short fiction spanning different genres. He's also the author behind the graphic novel "Frankenstein for Mayor." and one of the four minds behind the Columbus Scribbler, a free comics newspaper about Columbus comics creators.
Chris Allen is the co-creator of Disposable Fiction Comics and Swampline Comics, a UK comic studio who publish a number of comics including Dracustein, Star Claws, Disturbia, Tomb of Horror anthologies, Resurrected, Toothville, Scavenger and many others.
Reinaldo Lay Contreras has degree in architecture from University of the Americas (Chile). Rei has been drawing comics professionally since 2012 for Chile and abroad. He's a comic book teacher in Canvas Academy, Chile and has worked mainly for publishers in the U.S. and U.K.

campaign.story:
YOU DID IT! You (and over 170 backers like you) helped bring the digital series Night of the Mullets to print for the first time ever! The entire NotM teams THANKS YOU from the bottom of our hearts! 

My name's Boaz, I'm a screenwriter, and I'm obsessed with stories. Movies, novels, non-fiction, comic books, even jokes have always fascinated me, on a structural level: I’m a sucker for telling ‘em, listening to ‘em, and talking about why they do or don’t work. 
All my life I’ve tried to get as close to the craft of storytelling as I could. During the heyday of VHS and dawn of DVD I worked as a clerk at Austin's world-famous Vulcan Video. I attended film school, worked in commercials, directed a feature comedy, created a blog, and spent years writing dialogue for anime, cramming English into Japanese mouth-flaps on shows such as Mythical Detective Loki Ragnarok, Shadow Skill and UFO Princess Valkyrie. I’ve written over two dozen screenplays and currently have a TV series in development at a major Hollywood studio.  
And... I’m the creator/writer of Night of the Mullets, the comic book series we offered right here for the first time ever in physical form! 
THE ORIGINS OF "NIGHT OF THE MULLETS"
Night of the Mullets began its life as a screenplay in the early 2000's. The story was inspired not only by the giant, Texas-sized cockroaches that kept surprising me in various kitchens growing up, but also the movies I loved… from ultra-cool sci-fi satires like Alex Cox's Repo Man to the face-huggers of Ridley Scott's Alien to the body-snatching paranoia of John Carpenter's The Thing and Philip Kaufman's Invasion of the Body Snatchers (that freakin’ dog still haunts my dreams!)  
In 2008, after a draft of the screenplay made it to the quarterfinals of the Austin Film Festival, some producers approached me about making a Night of the Mullets film. But ultimately, despite the fact that it was envisioned as a low-budget creature-feature, the budget was simply too low to do the story justice. So I turned my attention to other projects, and continued my pursuit of a career in the storytelling industry.  
PLAY

(above: Mullet walk-mechanic designed by Jason Gary, 2010) 
But over the years, Night of the Mullets kept nipping at the back of my skull, and eventually I returned to it, with the goal of adapting it into a comic book, where the story could finally scuttle out of my brain and infest the minds of others.  
And ultimately, after a lot of hard work by a fantastic team of artists, we ended up with a fun product we're all very proud of, which will look amazing sitting on your shelf!  
MEET OUR TEAM OF ARTISTS: 
Interior Artist Valentin Ramon with his alternate first issue cover!
Original cover for issue number 1 by Jim Mahfood!
Original cover for issue number 2 by Grim Wilkins!
Original cover for issue number 3 by Farel Dalrymple!
Original cover for issue number 4 by Michael Ramstead!
Original cover for issue number 5 by Ulises Fariñas!
The incredible talents of our lettering crew!
And of course the TPB cover by Alchemichael
WHY SUPPORT THIS PROJECT?
If you're like me, you love discovering content that's off-the-beaten path. At the edges of discourse we often find viewpoints far removed from what's accepted or expected. In my youth I found these unique perspectives in the pages of comics such as Shade the Changing Man, Concrete, Madman, Cerebus and Akira, each offering weird, off-kilter, challenging (& critical) outlooks on a world that's too often simplified by popular "inside-the-box" narratives.
But while they were once risky, today's comics and genre films have become fodder for big-budget tentpoles, with manicured commercial messages that say little about life. Whether intentionally or not, the mainstream is gentrifying the margins of our collective consciousness, and the only way to push back against its "formulaic creep" is to empower independent voices whose stories share some insight into the human condition, so that others might feel inspired... or even included at all. 
Injecting varied viewpoints into the cultural bloodstream is vital to society as a whole, to fortify discourse and keep the body-politic healthy. The content I aspire towards creating (with the help of collaborators and friends) aims to feed the fringes and "keep the periphery weird," in order to keep the cycle of discourse from growing stagnant, and to ensure future travelers have far-out destinations to venture to! 
SO WHAT’S IT ALL ABOUT?
Night of the Mullets is the story of a down-on-his-luck guy named Gabe who teams up with an all-female resistance known as "The Hairforce" to fight a hairy alien invasion that's been going on for centuries.
That's right: the hairdo-you-love-to-hate is actually the by-product of an intergalactic infestation that's happening right under our noses (and also right above our foreheads).
This means that while some of your neighbors' mullets are natural (or "terrestrial"), others are in fact camouflaged xenosites: parasitic puppet-masters feeding on the male brain, treating their hosts like rental cars, pushing them on to get the grey matter pumping and juices flowing!   
Early designs by Valentin Ramon
Mullet "ground zero" is Crater Springs, TX, where the bugs have been landing for centuries, and where local oil baron Elwood Dix has discovered that the mullet queen's veins contain a valuable fluid that can be converted to energy. And being that he's the richest man 'round these parts, Dix has corrupted the local authorities, to ensure they'll stop at nothing to put his nefarious plans into motion! 
A wild-n'-hairy romp that mashes up the body-snatcher and zombie genres with creature-features like Critters, Tremors, Gremlins, The Blob, The Deadly Spawn and many more, the series features incredible illustration by artist Valentin Ramon (D4VE, Hot Damn, Born in Hell, Z), whose high-quality, full-color artwork will suck you into a rich world of vibrant characters and crazy critter shenanigans.  
The trade paperback is 100% complete and ready to print! From 2015-2018, the series appeared on the digital-only platform comiXology, but artwork this amazing deserves to be experienced on the page, in full glossy color, which is why we're setting it loose upon the world! 
Check out all that work! But don't look too closely - there's SPOILERS in there!
This gorgeous book collects the entire 5 issue run with a brand new cover by Michael Lee Macdonald (Island, Heart of Weirdness, Blood and Stars, DISMAS, etc.):            
I know I'm biased but darned if that ain't one handsome cover!
AND... included within the TPB's pages are all the original covers from comiXology's run, as well as exclusive extras not found in those digital issues... including pin-ups, pencils and back-of-the-book features designed to include you, the audience, so that you can be directly associated with our project for all of posterity!  
SO... WHAT DO YOU GET FOR HELPING US OUT? 
Consult the "pyramid" for a quick visual reference...
To go along with the above infographic, you'll find a more in-depth explanation of our tiers along the right margin of the page (up top, under "PLEDGES"). And here's a KEY to help you discern the individual items available to you for helping us meet our goal:  
FINAL PRODUCT MAY VARY IN APPEARANCE
When referencing the PLEDGES you'll notice additional MULTI-PACK tiers: these are available to everyone, but catered towards encouraging small businesses to offer the book, in-store:  
The more you buy, the more you save!
Also remember that all pledges at The Thing! ($25) level and above will be eligible for our stretch goal rewards: This means that when the campaign reaches these marks that go beyond our initial fundraising target, you'll get extra swag!   
Besides going towards recouping production expenses, your support allows us to bring down the overall printing cost (read more about printing costs here). What this means is that the more friends you enlist in our campaign, and the more friends those friends enlist, the more generous we can be with our stretch rewards!   
And when you join the Night of the Mullets family, you'll also be added (unless you opt out) to the GOOD GOLEM MEDIA mailing list, where you'll be first to know about our upcoming comic and other media projects!      
Thanks for taking the time to read this kickstarter campaign page! I hope you join our adventure and tell all your friends, so we can continue to widen our audience of fellow enthusiasts who love weird and exciting content! Who knows, if this goes well, we might even try to create a first person Night of the Mullets  video game... or maybe even put a crew together to film the opening sequence! Let's do this stuff!  
PLAY

 (above: Hmm... there's something strange going on here!!)
And remember: this collector's edition TPB is limited and may never be reprinted - so make sure you get your copy... and don't forget to help spread the word, so we can add more generous gifts! After all, these bodies aren't gonna snatch themselves!        
AND ONE LAST THING:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The comic book pages are 100% finished! There's no risk of the project not reaching fruition - the entire book is laid out and ready to print, the artists have all been paid, and we're simply trying to get the word out and grow our audience, so we can afford the largest print-run possible! 

However, there are still risks, including unforeseen third-party delays, printing problems, or lags in getting the additional materials into the "Party Out Back" section in the time advertised, etc. 

BUT... given my experience in bringing low-budget films and commercials in on-time and under-budget, as well as my general OCD-fueled attention to detail, I'm confident any and all issues will be minimized and mitigated.

I've done my research, consulted with friends and mentors who've been through this process numerous times, and I am ready to nip any problems in the bud. Throughout the process of putting this campaign together, I've done my best to keep things simple, make conservative estimations, and allow plenty of room for error. 

In other words, I'm confident that should we be lucky enough to get funded I will do my utmost to deliver the book and all rewards in a timely and well-packaged manner, to your satisfaction - and to communicate openly throughout the entire process!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We feel Christmas needs to be a little weirder.
My name is Daniel Gelon and along with my wife, illustrator Heather  Hudson, we are Studio WonderCabinet. Our goal is to make awesome art and products that embrace the magical and fantastic.
We both grew up at a time when the holidays meant cards - a mantel full of them.  We still love getting holiday cards, but even more we love giving them. We love cards that reflect our special view of the universe. For years we made our own cards by hand, but 4 years ago we wanted to do more. We  wanted to share our cards with the world so you too could give your friends and family cards that reflect the weirdness of the holidays. We’ve had 3 successful Christmas card campaigns. The first campaign was for HP Lovecraft-inspired Cthulhu mythos cards. The second was was for cards inspired by Robert Chamber’s King in Yellow. The year before last we finished our "trilogy" with Christmas cards inspired by Lovecraft's Dreamlands.
This year we explore older Christmas myths and invite the Krampus to come play with us.
What is the Krampus?
In central European folklore, St. Nick has a dark counterpart in the form of a anthropomorphic beast-man called the Krampus. Santa gives good little boys and girls presents and toys, but the Krampus has scarier "treats" for naughty children.  Be bad and you might escape with coal in your stocking but more likely the Krampus would beat you with his switch of birch sticks. If a child had been particularly bad, they could be carried away in the Krampus' basket, taken back to his lair for a torturous end. It seems horrific but don't worry, St. Nick is totally on board with this horrible beastie and his methods.
The Project
We are creating Krampus Christmas cards, gift wrap and ornaments.
The Cards
We have 5 cards planned this year. The card paintings are all finished. We have chosen a printer and costed materials. Each of the 5 by 7 inch cards will come with its own holiday red envelope. Heather has been hard at work making the cards  beautiful. This she's been highly influenced by classic Victorian Krampus art with a little 1930's Weimar Republic imagery thrown into the mix. The images are all large hand-painted watercolors with a classic illustration feel to them . They will be printed on a heavy 15 pt (130 lb) velvet cover stock (the same as our previous cards). Just like previous years’ cards they are meant to look like "normal" Christmas cards when viewed across the room on the mantel. It’s only when you get closer that their true nature becomes apparent.
Krampus Card 1 - Krampus Wreath
Krampus Card 2 - Greetings from Krampus
Krampus Card 3 - St. Nicolas's Krampus
Krampus Card 4 - Krampus Defeated
Krampus Card 5 - Modern Problems Krampus
The PDFs
Like previous card campaigns, we will offer a PDF of the cards for those backers who would like to print their own cards, or for our European backers who want cards for Krampusnacht. Everyone who gets a physical set of cards also gets the PDF. PDFs are provided in both US and EU standard sizes to match standard paper and envelope sizes. The PDF is for the cards only, there will be no gift wrap or ornament PDFs.
The Gift Wrap
The Cthulhu gift wrap proved very popular so we are doing Krampus gift wrap this year.  The 18" x 24"  gift wrap comes in five folded sheets. It folds down to 9 x 12 so we can fit it into a standard mailer. The last gift wraps were printed on a 70 lb. high quality matte stock. The paper was gorgeous with a great "touch feel" but could be a little hard to wrap due to its thickness. We are looking into alternative paper thicknesses, but if we can't find a paper we feel is of as high a quality we will use the same paper again this year.  A single sheet will wrap a small or moderately-sized box. It’s perfect for wrapping books. We are starting with five sheets of a single design, with a stretch goal of having five unique designs in the pack.
The Ornament Set
This year we are trying our hand at ornaments. The set comes with 3 different vintage-style ornaments. They are full-color die cut images backed with heavy card board and are approximately 3.5 x 4.5 inches.
The ornaments
Original Art
We are also offering reward levels featuring the original art. Each piece of art comes with a set of cards, ornaments and gift wrap. The original paintings are large pieces measuring 11" x 14””, rendered in watercolor on 140 lb. watercolor paper. They have been painted to fit standard mats and frames. 
 Gift Tags
We have a set of 6 gift tags (2 each of 3 different designs) that are a special reward for our backers either as a PDF or professionally printed on card stock (2 x 3 inches). To receive them you have to back the campaign for either any physically product or PDFs and you have to give us a shout out on the internet in social media or group or forum or a community. To get more details read Update #2.
2 sets of three tags

At $6,500 we will add holiday wishes with festive type and charming graphics to the interior of the cards.
$7,000 Printing on envelopes
At $7,000 we will add stunning holiday art to the flap of every envelope.
$8,000 Krampus envelope seal
At $8,000 we will add a  2 x 3 inch die cut seal printed on a paper sticker.

Rewards 
We need you to become our partners
This is where you come in. We need your help to offset around 2/3 of the printing costs. We would like to have enough funding to print cards for both the Kickstarter rewards and to stock them for next year. Timelines are tight but we have our printers' assurances that printing will start right after the Kickstarter finishes and we can ship cards out in good time for you to send them for the holidays. We want to get them to you by the end of November or the start of December. We have been told that we have the fastest turnaround of any campaign that our supporters have backed. Help us to achieve our vision of making the holidays a little weirder. You will get your own beautifully printed cards for starting a new holiday tradition of your own.
Timing and Shipping Costs
Shipping costs are high. We charge only for the cost of packaging and shipping, and in each of our past campaigns we have underestimated shipping costs and have paid the price. Christmas is coming and we have to move fast. The day after the campaign ends, surveys go out. The next week we tally up the totals and tell the printers that the files that they have been sitting on are good to go. Everything is printed in the USA and delivered by truck to our door. Fourteen days after the campaign ends, Kickstarter pays us; the balance of the printed rewards costs can be paid and the rewards shipped to us. Shipping arrives a week later, in mid-November. If anything goes wrong we have a chance to fix it and be ready by the first week of December. Because of these time lines, shipping has to go as fast as possible. Everything is shipped in a rigid package to ensure your rewards reach you undamaged. For rewards in the North-West we use First Class mail (2- 3 day delivery time), for the rest of the country we use USPS flat rate Priority mail (again, with a 2 - 3 day delivery time). We use rigid packaging to protect the art.  We want your rewards to arrive pristine and as fast as possible for you to be able to use them in the Christmas season. As a result of rising postage rates, it now costs a dollar more to ship a single card than the cost of the card itself. 
International shipping
We have made the tough decision that we will not be shipping internationally with this campaign. Between VAT and changing US commerce laws dealing with tax collection as well as some experiences we had with foreign shipping in the last campaign, we just can't.  If you do live outside the US, we would still like your support and we ask that you consider getting the PDFs. We can guarantee that Europeans will have their PDFs in time to use for Krampusnacht. 
Who are we?
Heather paints the pictures, Daniel handles the rest. 
Daniel Gelon
Daniel has over 30 years of art experience. He has  done illustration, UX, graphic design, production and art direction. He  has illustrated Magic cards, created logos for DC comics, art directed  Dungeons and Dragons books and has worked on various video games. He is  obsessed with machines made of paper.
Heather Hudson
Heather Hudson is a fantasy artist with a traditional sensibility and a love of early-20th century popular culture. She’s worked on tabletop and hobby games  including Hasbro's “Magic; the Gathering” and Pagan Publishing's modern  Mythos RPG “Delta Green.” Past Lovecraftian projects she's illustrated  include "Casino R'lyeh, the Lovecraft Poker Deck," and "Mother Hydra's  Mythos Rhymes." Currently she divides her time between commissioned  illustration, personal projects and creating her own fantasy world  somewhere between Oz and the Dreamlands. She has a fondness for illuminating monsters.

Risks and challenges
This is our 4th time on this carousal. 

We run extremely fast turnarounds to make the holiday season deadline. There are a lot of moving parts. The final files are in the printers hands before the end of the Kickstarter. The day after the campaign ends surveys go out and the printers get out final count for the jobs and it takes several weeks for the jobs to arrive to us. Heather and I fold sort and collate everything by hand but we do our best at hacking through the rewards to get them out in a timely manner. The process could gum up at any point. We know this and this will be our 4th time doing this. We know all the timing and have all our systems in place best we can. We also have enough wiggle room to do expedited printing with the same printer or an alternate printer if things really go south. The ornaments are new to us this year as well as the printer we are working with on them but they had good recommendations so we don't anticipate problems. We are confident that we will have product in time to get it into your hands with time to send out for the holidays.

campaign.story:
Ned Hume is not having a good week.
His career as an actor..... Well, to call it "struggling" is generous.
His girlfriend has begun to bring up the dreaded subjects of marriage and kids. (He's settled on the tried and true tactics of deflection and feigned hysterical deafness.)
His brother has just died. Yeah, he was an ass, but still, y'know, family.
And then there's the fact that he's lost his mind. At least Ned hopes he's lost his mind. What else could explain the hallucinations? This morning, on the streets of Manhattan, he started seeing creatures. Monsters; Grotesqueries; Demons; shambling, crawling or oozing along with the usual NYC sidewalk crowd. No one seems to notice them. But he sees them. 
And they see him.
And while some might turn out to be more lost than menacing, a ten foot tall fanged and tentacle-waving nightmare asking for directions to the nearest subway station is no less disturbing. Ned's lost his mind, right? That's what he hopes. Unfortunately...
Ned and a new friend
  As you can guess from the title, NED is not the name of a person you'd expect to be the ruler of a Pit in the bowels of Hell. (Actually, I'm not sure I want him near the bowels of anything.) Or involved in the supernatural at all for that matter. He agrees wholeheartedly, and would prefer it not be so. But in this new, original 144 page graphic novel written and drawn by me, I don't give him a choice.
It's a funny (to us) and frightening (especially to him) story of an average guy discovering the world is so much stranger than he thought, and his family (himself included) are way more connected to the darker, scarier side of reality than he knew or would ever ever want. The darker side, it turns out, doesn't want him either. 
The book!-- Or at least what it looks like in Photoshop (if we go HC).
This first volume (the story does continue) runs over 130 pages of story; as I draw, I keep adding pages, letting scenes breathe so the page count is not set in stone. There's a great thing about creator-owned and Kickstarter: No editor saying "Can you have this five pages fit into three, even though it screws up the storytelling and kills the gags and any suspense?" It'll be soft-cover (fingers crossed for the hardcover stretch goal), and there'll be extras of course, like behind the scenes goodies; of course the THANK YOU page listing the name of every backer; and guest pin-ups by Mike McKone, Tom Raney, Matt Clark and others to be announced. And a forward by Louise Simonson.
In 30+ years working in comics, besides various work on VALIANT books, Deadpool, Black Panther and the BAT-books, I've been lucky to have had extended runs on some great books with amazing writers. Peter David's AQUAMAN. Judd Winnick's EXILES. GOTHAM UNDERGROUND with Frank Tieri. RED LANTERNS with Charles Soule. SECRET SIX with Gail Simone. I love comics; it's all I've ever wanted to do since I can remember wanting to do something other than soil my diaper... though I guess that wasn't really a conscious decision. (I swear.) And all I want to do is just keep making comics. My own comics. It took over twenty years to get back to doing my own stuff, and I'm happier for it.
I'm the not-so-cute one without the fur
THE VIDEO: Please check out the video, or if you have, I hope you got a chuckle out of it. It's amazing what a newb can do with iMovie; cool program. (For any Megalopolis fans, there is an "easter egg" from it in there too.) And here's some here's some serious bit I cut from the video to keep it shorter; and some outtakes:
PLAY

The music in the main video up top is UNDERTAKER by Son of Dave, who was nice enough to say "okay" when I asked him if I could use it for this. His songs have been featured in the TV shows Breaking Bad and Preacher. You can check him out on Bandcamp, Spotify or Youtube. Really cool stuff. And the soundfx I layered in were royalty-free from Soundbible: Tasmanina Devil (Daniel Simon); Devil Dog Crazy, Child Scream Sound & Upper Cut (Mike Koenig).
Plans are to print in the US, with the goal of printing minimum 5,000 copies. All backers will be listed in a THANK YOU page in the book; and each book will come with a custom NedLOP bookmark and postcard inside (just because I think they're fun). The $25 pledge level will get you the physical book; $35 (and all levels above) adds a Kickstarter exclusive full-color illustrated bookplate signed by me.
SHIPPING- 
USA- $10
Canada- $15
The Rest of the World- $25
 About some of the premium levels:
$85 - REMARK-- This is simply a b&w full head-sketch that's done on the inside front cover or first blank page of the book. Backer's choice of character. (People use the term "remark" different ways; this is how I mean it.) **Amount is limited**
$195 - SKETCH TIME-- This is more of a con-style 9x12 sketch; it's the size I work at conventions when I'm sitting in Artist Alley. Single figure with a simple background. Below is an example of a 9x12 done recently. **Amount is limited**
9x12 con-style commission done recently at a convention
$375 - BIG-TIME SKETCH TIME-- This is a full 11x17 illustration, like a cover for print. Single figure with a simple background. Below is an example of an 11x17 done for a previous campaign. **Amount is limited**
11x17 single figure done for a previous Kickstarter
*NOTE*  If you'd like to do a bigger, more complex, (multi-character, detailed background, a jam-board laid out, etc), message me before pledging and we'll discuss it and come up with a pledge amount. Below are a couple examples of more complex commissions.
11x17 multi-character commission with detailed background- $700
11x17 single character with crazy-detailed background- $500
 SHIPPING- Note that there is an additional shipping charge for the commissions (not the REMARK of course; that is done in the book itself) as they are shipped separately:
USA- $20 addt'l
Canada- $25 addt'l
Rest of the World- $35 addt'l
 Hardcover is always the big request by backers, so I hope we make it.
A Kickstarter exclusive mini-print (all new image just for the print) ships with the book
 Just those for now; I don't like to jinx it. Concentrating right now on my first goals. If we do really well, I have some other more substantial ideas, like more story...
Hell... or in close proximity thereof
Thanks for checking out my project. It will only be done because of you, and it's impossible to say how much, funded or not, I appreciate everyone who supports this project.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my third Kickstarter. It's been a few years since the success of LEAVING MEGALOPOLIS with Gail Simone, and I've been itching to get back to creator-owned, especially something I created from scratch. But I did want to makes sure at least part of this project was in the can before the campaign, and about half the 130+ pages are done. And I'm continuing to work as the campaign runs. Just to be safe, as life has an annoying way of intervening, I'm allotting 4 months for completion of the book (including colors, lettering, production etc). Then I'm at the mercy of the printer's schedule, followed by shipping. Hopefully all of this will take no more than six months. Like I said, life can be very obstinate about the plans of mice & men, but I think this is a safe deadline. Some rewards, like the sketches, should ship much earlier.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What do you get when you mix a fire at a research lab in a crime ridden city and a full blown conspiracy? 
You get The Seer Chronicles!
A firefighter by the name John Benson arrives at a research lab called Psycorp Inc. engulfed in flames. He does what any heroic firefighter would do and goes in to save lives. Well, while searching for any sign of people still in the lab the building buries him  until he is later reborn and has to figure out how and why he is brought back.
This is issue 1 of a full blown trilogy which is already completely written! This Deluxe edition includes 25 pages of an action packed story that showcases multiple points of view from different characters all over Seer City. We plan on making larger issues in the future to get the story told at a better pace.  
Why I wrote this story.
 My uncle is a retired firefighter, he was literally the first person from my life that I added to this story. Firefighters risk their lives for others DAILY. He made it through years saving others and doing that it comes with a price mentally and physically. Though we don't dive deep into that aspect we do dive into what it means being a hero and the consequences that comes with being a hero. On top of all of that this is part of a 1200 page trilogy I wrote and I'd like it told! Also, it might be bias, but the story is pretty freaking bad ass!

campaign.story:
Update: Stretch goals!
We've surpassed our initial goal! In celebration, and as a thank you for backing and believing this project, we've created two stretch goals:
$8,000: Consent stickers. If we surpass this amount of funding, every backer who is already getting physical rewards in the mail will also receive some Dr. Faith-y stickers about the important meanings of the words yes and no.
$12,000: Consent zine! At this level of funding, each backer who is already receiving a physical reward in the mail will also receive Dr. Faith's to-be-released zine Unf*ck Your Consent.
About this project
Dr. Faith's newest book is all about boundaries and consent. 
Kickstarter's challenge to "break" their system by using it in an unexpected way inspired us to make our boundaries more flexible, specifically around the price of the book. 
tl;dr: We're offering a sliding scale of $10-20 for Unf*ck Your Boundaries and a workbook that goes with it!
About the book
At its core, this book is about unf*ckening our interactions with others. It contains these parts, and will leave you with some seriously badass skills at holding your own boundaries and understanding and respecting others'.
What are boundaries? What is consent? Why are these things important? What are they not?
How do our boundaries get f*cked up? This section covers some heavy background, from family to culture, with a whole lot of gender thrown into the mix, because, you know, #metoo.
What do boundary violations look like in practice? Learn to recognize them like a champ. Also learn to spot patterns of extreme, controlling boundary busting.
Unf*ck your boundaries! The second half of the book contains much excellent information for understanding and communicating your own boundaries, troubleshooting, holding yourself and others accountable, and building a life where your boundaries aren't too strict or too soft, but can be just right for you.  
Unf*ck Your Boundaries by Faith G. Harper, PhD, LPC-S, ACS, ACN is a 128 page, 5x7 inch paperback book, illustrated by Trista Vercher and printed in Illinois.
And there's a workbook! Real therapist exercises to fill out as you explore how to become a champion communicator and respecter of boundaries.  
About the rewards
The sliding scale price!
The basic reward for this project has two parts: Unf*ck Your Boundaries and its accompanying workbook. The cover price is $9.95 for the paperback + $4.95 for the workbook zine, so the regular price for both would be $14.90. 
We are offering these books on a sliding scale, and invite you to pay anywhere from $10 to $20. The calculation of what you are able to pay, as well as what the books are worth for you, is totally up to you.  
We have long offered sliding scale on our own website as a way to make our books accessible to a wide range of readers. The lowest end covers our costs and still allows us to pay the author a royalty. The higher end essentially subsidizes the lower end. We've found that when people are offered a sliding scale and pay what works best for them, we typically end up earning an average that is very close to the actual cover price. We're curious to see if the same thing will happen in this project!
Of course, you can skip this experiment and just get one of these reward levels with more books! They're already priced about as low as we can manage—you're welcome to pledge higher than the asking price if you're feeling it.
I want better boundaries in daily life
Looking to improve your boundaries at home, at work, with friends, in line at the post office? This pack of Dr. Faith books and zines that help you do just exactly that. 
Unf*ck Your Boundaries
Unf*ck Your Boundaries Workbook
 Unf*ck Your Adulting - Soooo much of this book is about recognizing what belongs to you and what belongs to someone else. 
 Unf*ck Your Work - A zine about kicking butt at work, which again, is a lot about recognizing your own agency and locus of control.
 Defriending - A zine about how to break off any kind of relationship while leaving room for both of you to walk away with dignity.
I want help with consent 
Unf*ck Your Boundaries
Unf*ck Your Boundaries Workbook
 Consensuality - Helen Wildfell's great book about learning to be an adult in your intimate relationships
 Learning Good Consent - Cindy Crabb's book about the importance of respecting each others' autonomy

About the author
Dr. Faith G. Harper did her PhD research on how epigenetic trauma is passed down between generations, and has been helping people break the cycle and live happy, healthy lives with her no-nonsense style of writing, therapy, and clinical training ever since. She is a Licensed Professional Counselor and Board Supervisor in Texas, and holds postdoctoral certificates in nutrition and sexology. She identifies as a woman of color and an intersectional feminist. 
About the publisher
A very sunny day this year, when we received 11 pallets of books.
Born out of adverse beginnings, Microcosm is an independent publisher and distributor of books and zines about self-empowering topics, now for over 23 years. The books we love best are the ones, like Unf*ck Your Boundaries, that we wish we'd been able to read back when we first started. We are scrappy, rapidly growing, worker-owned, and based in Portland, Oregon.
Thank you for supporting independent publishing!

updates.update_userinfo: New from Dr. Faith: Woke Parenting
updates.update_content:
It's hard to imagine many situations where boundaries are more important than... parenting. 
Dr. Faith and fellow therapist (and fellow parent) Bonnie Scott have teamed up to bring us Woke Parenting, a child-rearing guide for the 21st century that addresses parenting tactics for dealing with systemic racism and sexism, consent and healthy sexuality, and teaching your kids to navigate all the BS and difficulties of late stage capitalism while still respecting themselves and not being shitty to others.

Hi all - Can we ask for your assistance? 
We're in a bit of a jam with our current Kickstarter project, the Gold Lyre Tarot. There's just one day left to raise the last $2500 we need to print our first tarot deck. 
If you've got the means and you would enjoy having (or gifting!) a queer deck that centers the divine feminine without the gender binaries of most decks, please consider backing. You'll get a deck (and some other books and goodies), help us make this thing happen, and support our being able to take risks in future publishing projects. 
Thank you! <3

updates.update_userinfo: New from Dr. Faith: How to Be Accountable
updates.update_content:
So much of boundaries are about knowing how to communicate about what you are and are not responsible for, and owning up to the stuff that is within your own purview. 
How to Be Accountable, the next book by Dr. Faith, co-authored with Microcosm publisher Joe Biel, takes that to the next level, walking us through the skills we need to understand and change our behavior, habits, and patterns. It's funding on Kickstarter now - check it out and back it if you could use a solid framework for change.

We've been tossing this idea around for a while, of putting together a sort of game or deck to go with Unf*ck Your Boundaries, and it's finally happening: The Boundaries Conversation Deck is live on Kickstarter!
The deck is made up of 52 cards that ask you to reflect on or discuss a ton of different topics and situations about your boundaries, consent, and needs. There are no right answers, only good conversations. You can use them on your own like an extremely plainspoken oracle deck, as a bonding exercise, or in therapy contexts.

updates.update_userinfo: Dr. Faith's newest: Unf*ck Your Year (plus, the best boundaries practice ever)
updates.update_content:
Hey friends,
At first, I thought all this social distancing would just mean a ton of loneliness and isolation. And surely there's been an uptick in that, but what took me by surprise is that suddenly everyone is practicing their boundaries and consent skills on a day-to-day level. I've heard things in the last week like, "I know I shouldn't shake your hand, would you like an elbow bump?," "Would you mind disinfecting your hands before coming in?," and "Can I get you anything from the store? Where would you like me to leave it?"

updates.update_userinfo: Something a little different: Mostly True, 100 years of boxcar graffiti & hobo lore
updates.update_content:
Hi all, 
Even though sometimes it seems like our whole publication line is full of cheerful, practical mental health books, we got our start publishing things of a more punk, underground, DIY nature...
Or maybe I should back that up. Because what is more punk or subversive or DIY than taking control of your own life and mental health? And for many of us the best way to do that at one time or another is hitting the open road or rails.

updates.update_userinfo: New Dr. Faith on KS: Unf*ck Your Worth!
updates.update_content:
Hi all, we're at it again: our next book, Detox Your Place, is live on Kickstarter. 
It's a handy guide to making a healthier house, room, or apartment, with tons of recipes and sources for everyday products that won't add to your toxic load. It's based on author Meadow Shadowhawk's decades of research and experimentation to keep herself and her family super healthy in the shadow of the manufacturing plants near their home.
What I like about this book is that it has a mix of changes you can implement (and see results from!) right now, like making your own cleaning products and not wearing shoes in the home, and longer-term investments to plan for, everything from vacuum cleaners to home insulation. Knowledge is power!

campaign.story:
What if everything important in your life is violently taken from you? Your family, friends, and your magical powers are gone. You awaken to a familiar but different world. You don't know why this is happening. The only thing you know is that the monsters of New Orleans are involved. 
Follow our hero, Jonas, as he battles these monsters to regain the life and powers he once had. But the things he will have to do may turn him into the same monster he is out to destroy.   
This Kickstarter campaign is to fund the printing of issue #2. But don't worry, you can also pick up issue #1 in this campaign!
There will be 28 pages of amazing black and white art and story with quality gloss paper that will make the artwork pop. Here's a look at the regular and variant cover of issue #2.
Regular Cover (left) / Variant Cover (right)
 Gian Carlo Bernal is an artist and lives in the Philippines with his son and wife. In 2014 after 11 years as a graphic designer he left his job to become a comic book illustrator. He's never looked back. Gian has drawn for other Kickstarter comic book campaigns such as the Last Days of Kevin and Ronin. He's been quoted as saying "And now I am happy to be working on Crescent City Monsters. I will draw until I die, my body rot and I will come back as a zombie and draw comics again."  
 Newton Lilavois is a Haitian-American who lives in New York City with his wife and daughters. By day he's a computer programmer. When he's not writing code, he's writing stories. 
As an eleven years old boy, Newton used to draw comics and sell them to classmates. As an adult Newton decided to fulfill his dream of creating comic books and Crescent City Monsters was born.
 WHY DID I CREATE THIS STORY?
As a Haitian-American I wanted to introduce the rich Haitian Voodoo lore to comic books readers through more authentic lens. Mix that with my love for dark gritty stories and the urge to create a zombie story, and you have the delicious gumbo called Crescent City Monsters.
WHAT ARE OUR FANS SAYING:
"Newton Lilavois’s story keeps you hooked and eager to see its direction. With an amazing ending that leaves you wondering and wanting more. He has done an amazing job on mood, character personalities and over all story that never loses interest. Gian Carlo Bernal’s cover had me hooked at first sight. His detail and style is in a class of its own for me. As soon as you see it, you want to open the comic. And yes, the inside is as detailed as the cover. These two amazing guys are a hard hitting tag team destined for delivering great books." - Tell Diam
"I love horror as a genre and I definitely think there should be more horror comics out there. I walk into a comic book store and there’s a tiny horror section if there is any. I also love the historical period setting crescent city monster is placed in. I definitely want to see where the story will go!" - Leona Kumagai
"Take it from a guy who has been reading comics for 50 years - this is one of the very BEST! Amazing art, stylish prose and an exciting, fascinating plot. The best thing I've read in decades!" - Vic Casados
"Absolutely loved this amazing story and unique artwork!! Definitely look forward to the next chapter in this masterpiece from the dream fury crew." - Chris Mason

We're accepting pictures of fans holding their copy of Crescent City Monsters as the campaign continues. Feel free to submit yours. We want this collage to be full as possible.


 WHY KICKSTARTER?
Kickstarter is great for independent creators like myself who need access to funds and want to find an audience for their awesome projects. In 2018, when my first Kickstarter project was successfully funded, I was introduced to over 200 amazing new fans. 
I've been a Kickstarter backer since 2013 and I love the platform. I've backed over 150 projects.  So, besides using the platform for my own creative endeavors, I believe in the idea of supporting other creators via crowdfunding on Kickstarter. 
WHAT WILL THE FUNDS BE USED FOR?
Except for a few last minute text changes, issue two is complete. The artwork, lettering, and design is all paid for so the funds will be used for printing issue two. 

CHECK OUT A FEW PAGES
Artwork by Gian Carlo Bernal
Artwork by Gian Carlo Bernal

Check out were it all starts! Issue #1 introduces blues musician and sorcerer, Jonas Alexandre Atelus, and the supernatural world he lives in. Everything goes wrong when a mysterious being puts a supernatural bounty on Jonas. Jonas is in the fight of his life as he battles the monsters of Crescent City. The story will have you hooked!
You've been asking for it and here it is! Find out in Issue #2 what happens to our New Orleans sorcerer, Jonas, after his vicious battle with the Grunch monsters. We introduce new characters and monsters that you will love.
New to the Crescent City Monsters story? Catch up with both issues #1 & 2.  Gian Carlo Bernal's artwork is amazing and the story will have you hooked!
Catch up with Issue #1 (regular cover) & both cover versions of  issue #2! That's a total of 3 books. Note: The variant cover of issue #2 will be limited printing so they make great collector items.
Catch up with both issue #1 cover versions and the regular cover of issue #2. That's a total of 3 books!  Note: There were only 300 copies of the issue #1 variant cover in first printing so they're limited editions and make great collector items.
The Collector's Delight includes copies of the regular and variant versions of issue #1 and issue #2. That's a total of 4 comic books. Note: The variant covers of issue #1 & 2 are limited printings so they make great collector items.
The Exclusive Signature Series 1 is packaged with issue #1 regular cover signed by both artist Gian Carlo Bernal and creator Newton Lilavois. Gian lives in the Philippines so he's never gotten the chance to personally sign any of our books until now. Because of the time and expense of providing both signatures, for now, we've decided to provide these signed copies only on Kickstarter projects. This is your chance at collecting rare signed copies.
The Exclusive Signature Series 2 is packaged with both issue #1 cover versions signed by both artist Gian Carlo Bernal and creator Newton Lilavois. Gian lives in the Philippines so he's never gotten the chance to personally sign any of our books until now. Because of the time and expense of providing both signatures, for now, we've decided to provide these signed copies only on Kickstarter projects. This is your chance at collecting rare signed copies.
With this Exclusive Signature Series 3 you not only get rare signed copies of the book, but the books are also CBCS signature verified graded! Each Authentic Signature comic book is sealed in a crystal-clear (PETG) inner sleeve and encapsulated in tamper evident hard case.
THE PLAN 
It's really simple. We've completed chapter two. It's illustrated and lettered. Once the Kickstarter campaign is complete and the funds have been received, we're sending the files over to the printer so you can have the book in your hands at the scheduled delivery date.
YOUR SUPPORT IS APPRECIATED!
We’ve been getting amazing feedback about the first issue and we're excited about printing issue #2 for our fans. I’m looking forward to your support. I know with your pledges the campaign will be a success.
Thank You,

Newton & Gian
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk facing this project would be a delay with the printer's production and shipping. This is my second Kickstarter and I'm familiar with the printing and shipping process so I believe my schedule is well thought out, Except for a few more minor editorial changes the comic book is done so backers will only be waiting for the printers and myself to ship the books out. I've taken steps like making sure the printer is shipping from within the United States to make sure slight delays will not throw us totally off schedule. I've also buffered some time in the delivery date for some unforeseen circumstances. I acknowledge that even with all that said there could be something beyond my control or the printer's control that could cause a delay in fulfillment. In cases like this, I will communicate in a timely and consistent manner to keep my backers well aware of the situation.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Nix Comics 2019 Releases:
Last year Nix Comics offered a de-luxe subscription slate that included 8 print publications and 2 records. This year, things are a little more scaled back in terms of quantity, with only two planned publications, but maintained in levels of off kilter rock n roll quality!  I could use your help to bring these two great publications to press!
Kenttucky Pussy by Sexton Ming and J.T. Dockery
                A project 15 years in the making, Kenttucky Pussy is a comic book that combines the talents of noted rock n roll bohemes Sexton Ming and J.T. Dockery.  Originally conceived in 2004 as an illustrated poetry book to be published on JT’s Hanging Dog Productions imprint, "Kenttucky Pussy" is a classic DIY guts and bones effort: the guts provided by Sexton Ming’s inimitable poetry, hung on a skeletal system of JT Dockery’s equally inimitable graphic narration.  (You thinking "Fifteen years is a long time. Why did it take so long for this book to happen?"  As you might expect, it's a story unto itself, which we'll relate in JT's words in a future update!)  
You might also be asking :Who is Sexton Ming and why should you buy a comic with an off-color title based on his poetry?"   Die-hard 90s garage punk fans will know most of this, but for the uninitiated:
              Sexton Ming, along with Billy Childish, and others such as Tracey Emin, founded the Medway Poets in 1979.  Ming continued on writing, performing, making art & music, etc. from then to today, publishing books, putting out records & exhibiting paintings. He was a staple of the stable of artists releasing works on Billy Childish's Hangman imprint throughout the 1980s and otherwise beyond, proving himself to be one of the leaders of post punk garage rock revivalism & expressionism/surrealism by any means/forms necessary all the way back when post punk garage rock revivalism & expressionism by any means/forms necessary wasn't cool.
"Kenttucky Pussy
You came out of your Mother's womb. 
Her placenta she ate
You were the runt
Oh Kentuckykitten
You are tough but
A bit on the bendy side.
Oh Kentucky Pussy.
Smell the mouse."
Kenttucky Pussy will be 32 page plus cover black and white comic book with a projected run of only 200 copies. (It's like... limited... man...!) 
Artist (Dockery) and Author (Ming) circa 2000
Sketchbook Picture Sleeves: Volume 1 2016-2019
              Since 2016, Nix Comics publisher, writer and artist Ken Eppstein* has been selling 7” records with hand drawn picture sleeves taken from his sketchbook.   It started as both a fun way to dust off his dormant artistic skills and as a way to raise some money for publishing Nix Comics titles by adding some value to the huge pile of 7”s without picture sleeves that always seems to spontaneously generate in Ken's living room.  It became an ongoing art project.  This book will contain the first 120 picture sleeves drawn in that time, each one with a unique spin on the song title or artist’s persona.  
*That’s me writing in the third person… Cuz parallel structure makes for some weird shit when you’re both a publisher and artist.
This sketchbook will be 7"x7", 128 pages (color) and features an intro by Nix Comics contributor and fan favorite, Darren Merinuk.   Excerpt here:
"These cartoons are following the trail blazed by garage/punk rock (and related genres) itself: simple, stoopid, irreverent and willing to go upside your head in pursuit of a laugh, and once in awhile to maybe make a thoughtful point as well. "
Rewards:
The Basics:
For helping Nix Comics out with a $10 pledge you will receive a copy of "Kenttucky Pussy" 
For a $15 pledge you will receive a copy of "Sketchbook Picture Sleeves: Volume 1" 
For $20 you will receive both new books!
Limited Extras!
 NEW!  Original Art from "Kenttucky Pussy" MKI:  J.T. Dockery has uncovered the original illustrations intended to accompany Sexton Ming's poetry in the intended poetry book of 2004 and is offering them up to you!  Each piece is approximately 6x9, ink on bristol board.  You will also receive copies of both new books.  Pictures of each below!
 Picture Sleeves: I have listed a number of original pieces of art created for the Sketchbook project for $40 along with copies of both new Nix publications. (So you get 2 books, 1 piece of original art and a record!) Limit one per customer.  Scroll down for individual pictures and descriptions.
 Whole Lotta Sexton: For a $25 pledge you will receive "Kenttucky Pussy" plus a copy of Sexton Ming's long out of print poetry book "House of Nunn" (1999) with illustrations by JT Dockery!  5 available total.
 12" Picture Sleeves:  For $50  you can receive one of two 12" pieces of art I have done for larger format records plus both new books.  These 12"ers don't appear in the book! The first option is Joan Jett's Light of Day 12" single that also pays homage to Hammer vampire Films or a test pressing of a comp of cool 60s surfy instros titled "Concussion." You get the art, the record and the books! 
UNlimited Extras!
 STICKERS!  Long time supporter left scratching your head because Ken has finally taken a dive into the deep end of Niche pool?  Or maybe just too broke to pledge for a book?  I got ya covered!  You can pledge for 4 Nix Comics vinyl stickers featuring art by Ryan brinkerhoff and Rachel Deering.
 Back Issue Bonanza! For those of you who need to do a little catch up on Nix Comics stuff, for $40 you will receive both new books and any 5 Nix Comics back issues. (Well...  cheesy qualifier.... Any comic and record set counts as 2 issues, Collected "Vicar" stories counts as 3 issues, and Kent Grosswiler's "Beauty Found In Darkness" counts as all 5.)
 The Big Nix: For those of you who have never bought a Nix Comic, but like the looks of things and have an extra $150 burning a hole in your pocket, the Big Nix includes both new books, All 10 issues of "Nix Comics Quarterly," All 4 issues of "Nix Western Comics," All 3 issues of "Buck Slaughter's book of Rock n Roll Facts," all 3 issues of Bela Koe Krompecher's Columbus record store trilogy , all 5 issues of "Tales from the Crate," Mark Rudolph's "Closing Doors," "Pure Entertainment #1" and Kent Grosswiler's "Beauty Found In Darkness."  (That's 31 books total, if I'm countin' right!)

Notes About and Close Ups of Picture Sleeves Available As Rewards:
Below are pictures of each of the Picture Sleeves available as rewards for this project: direct from my sketchbook warts and all.  No photoshopped in corners or borders. No spelling corrections. No apologies!  What you see is what you get. (Obviously what you're paying for is the artwork more than the record.) Most of the records aren't particularly collectible, but are fun/cool and in pretty good shape. That said, I'm willing to answer any questions posed to me about the records. Just message me!
 Allen Toussaint: Country John:  (with a guest appearance by Dee Dee Ramone!) This one goes out to all the artists who complain about how hard it is to draw horses, and I ASSume (Har!) mules...  The secret is to only draw half a horse and cover up the remaining hard parts with an Amish dude..
 Alvin Cash & The Crawlers:  A really cool R&B dance tune on the late great Andre Williams record label.  The flip side is the equally cool instro Twine Time, co-written by Williams 
Bobby Freeman: C'mon And Swim: While I'll be the first to admit not being a Spielberg expert, I've never seen it mentioned anywhere that the famous poster art for Jaws was clearly a riff on the scene where Julie Adams is swimming in the Black Lagoon as the Creature peers upwards at her.  Anyways, pairing Freeman's happy dance 60s craze tune with classic horror is kinda what Nix Comics is all about!
Carl Perkins: Shine Shine Shine:  Making a liar out of myself already, this one is pretty much a straight riff on the album photo for "Country Boy's Dream" on Dollie Records.  You should check out that stuff if you are hungry for good hard to find Carl Perkins stuff.  I think it holds up well when compared to his Sun Records material.
The Coasters: Yakety Yak:  I have a bad habit of drawing pictures of vomiting people/animals and wondering why they don't sell.  I mean... C'mon...  am I the only one who thinks a yak yakking is funny!?
 The Coyote Men: Monkey Glands:  This record was originally part of a double 7" set, but I lost the other one somewheres.  Anyways, around 100 years ago there was a trend for men to get monkey glands sewn into their own nuts to promote virility...  Which somehow reminds me of the overly macho dudes making noise in comics these days.  No thank you! also, an uncommon self portrait.
The Creations: I'm Mad:  A great Norton Records EP that was almost lost when Hurricane Sandy demolished that great label's warehouse. (I bought a ton of "Sandy Survivors" There are a lot of those in the book and available as rewards)  The art is a tribute to Mad's Don Martin, natch!
 Bobby "Boris" Pickett  & The Cryptkicker 5: Monster Mash:  Every October I look forward to hearing this song at random places, like in the kitchen utensil section of Target or some such. 
 Danny Zell & The Zell Rocks:  Youngster Meets The Monster:  This sandy survivor reminds me of staying up late at night with my little B&W TV in my bedroom watching late night horror movies which sometimes scared the snot outta me! (Dirty clothes pushed up against the gap at the bottom of the door to prevent light leaking out and alerting my mom!)
 Dwight Twilley: Nothing's Ever Going to Change So Fast:  He's gonna change clothes fast cuz he's been caught in bed with that gunsel's girl... Get it!?  OK, kind of a stretch.  The non-Twilley characters are inspired by Anya Davidson's great 70s-set crime graphic novel "Lovers In The Garden"
 The Egyptians: Party Stomp:  I used this Sandy Survivor record to grapple with my fear of groups of children.  Is there a phobia for that?  Like I like some individual kids, but in groups of 3 or more I find them fuckin' terrifying.  More terrifying than clowns, for sure. 
Esquerita: Dew Drop Inn:  This sleeve features a portrait of Esquerita poking his head outta a window at the famous New Orleans night club, the Dew Drop Inn...  Which I thought was clever... but once I finished I found myself wondering if this Georgia resident meant a different more local to him Dew Drop!
 The Everly Brothers: Wake Up Little Susie:  So, Don and Phil were totally satanic cult leaders, right?  It makes sense to me...  and I WANT IN! 
 The Fools: Psycho Chicken:  So, fair warning, this hilarious jab at the super serious Talking Heads isn't a great record.  I mean... yes the song is silly, but moreover this record plays with a lot of noise/fuzz.  Buy it for the Hitchcock spoof art instead!
Jackie Lee: The New Watusi:  I assume that this is the same Jackie Lee, whose hit was "The Duck" but these R&B dance tunes are more instrumental than vocals centered.  (I know... Who cares?  Just dance like you got your spacesuit on!)
Jean Knight: Let The Good Times Roll: I hope Jean Knight doesn't mind me hijacking her cover of an R&B classic for a somewhat dark political statement.  (For the record, I'm not advocating chopping anyone's head off, I just think that the folks in power should remember that, push come to shove, it's an option for those not in power.)  
 Jean Knight: Mr. Big Stuff:  By the way... Jean Knight is gorgeous!
 The Larks: The Jerk: An easy pun, not so easy to draw smoke letters.  Came out alright, though!  I did this one a few years ago and I'm a little surprised no one has bought it off me.
 Little Johnny and the Silvertones: Rock 'Til The End of Time: I've done a few superhero mash-ups for this project, and looking back at them now I'm a little surprised at how often I've reached into Legion of Superheroes catalog for inspiration.  (This is their foe the Time Trapper... Who lives at the end of time... Right?)
 MOTO: Skinny Head:  OK, I confess that I did this one because I saw so many people on-line talking about how much they love the character MODOK.  Those people apparently don't also love obscure garage punk bands....
 The Mystreated: There's No Escape:  Apparently there wasn't any spellcheck either....
 The Olympics: The Bounce:  Another Legion of Superheroes reference with Bouncing Boy.  Oddly, when looking through reference images on google for good ol' Chuck Taine here, I found one where the artist (Fan artist I hope) drew him super buff, broad shouldered and skinny at the waste... with a six pack no less!!!  He's the fat kids' superhero!  Don't try and take him from us!!!
 The Olympics: The Slop:  This sleeve combines my interpretation of the classic comic book monster "The Heap" with a take on the "Latrine Monster" stories told to me at summer camp by counselors who I am sure were tired of campers taking midnight pee runs.
 Patsy Cline: Strange:  I also used basically the same gag for a Sun Ra single.  (That one was more of a Ditko riff as opposed to this one that mimicks Patsy's Greatest Hits art)  I guess now that you are most of the way through looking at these it's OK to let it spill that I constantly reuse jokes.  If it was funny once, it will be funny forever, right?
 Rachel Sweet:  OK... Drawing the hibernation pods on the Nostromo, which are pretty much all white, and a xenomorph, which is pretty much all black, was hard...  But getting Rachel Sweet's sideways pony tail done while she is pictured laying down?  IMPOSSIBLE!
Rufus Thomas: Do the Double Bump: While doing these write ups, I realized that I have 5 pieces that imply some sort of romantic relationship between people and animals.  7 if you count the Creature and a Werewolf.  Just to be clear... These are jokes. I don't think it's cool to screw animals.
 Sam And Dave: Wrap It Up:  A recurring problem I have had to work around with these sleeves is that I use cheap markers and most of the browns available are too dark to use as skin tones without risking an unintentional and unwanted racist caricature.  I cured that problem by buying a variety of more expensive water based brown markers.  The problem cropped up again with this sleeve where I wanted a black granite casket.  Went gray instead!
Sam Cooke: Trouble Blues:  I had a few good puns lined up for this sleeve, but found myself overcome with sadness over Cooke's gone-too-soon life and did this fairly straight take instead.  I was kind of bummed that the corner tore when I pulled it from my sketchbook, but really it's kind of appropriate.

 The Spitballs: Telstar:  I guess until I did this piece of art, it never occurred to me that Telstar was the inspiration for the appearance of the Deathstar in Star wars.
Sue Saad and the Next: Gimme Love, Gimme Pain:  A promo single for an LP that that ended up in the buck bins of every record store in the country.  It's not that Sue Saad and the Next were bad, they just weren't good enough to merit an 80s sized press run of LPs.  Looked cool, though.
 Sweet: Fox on the Run:  OK, so this actually has two intended science fiction references:  The obvious X-Files one and the hand is supposed to be like the sucker tipped hand of the Martian in the 50s war of the World movie.  I believe!
 Sylvain Sylvain:  This split portrait of Sylvain is one of my favorites, using both how he looked when the single was released and in his New York Dolls persona.
Tammy Wynette: The Wonders You Perform:  My intent with this sleeve was to combine a couple jokes... George Jones as a giant monster and Tammy Wynette dressed up as a superhero steeped in paganism while singing a gospel song.  The real comedy ended up being me misspelling Wynette and botching the lettering on the song so bad that I had to do a tape-over.
 Tom Robinson Band: 2-4-6-8 Motorway:  OK, it's a dumb joke, but I had a lot of fun drawing the Count.  Have you ever noticed how weird and psychedelic the inside of his cape is???  Go look it up!
Tom Robinson Band: Another example of doing a straight take despite a zillion puns coming to mind.  I love the first two TRB albums on Harvest records...  They are my idea of well done political punk/new wave.
Tommy Roe: Dizzy: Do I get a little high using cheap markers to hang these pieces together?  Yeah, sometimes.  It doesn't stop me from doing spot-fuckin-on self potrait work and X-Men fan comics.... 
The Vikings: Such A Love:  I don't know for sure whether or not Fran Tarkenton and Alan Page had a love affair, I just know that drawing heart shaped eyeballs inside of a football helmet was a lot harder than I thought it would be.  I ended up pasting some hearts on.
 The Who: Whiskey Man:  With all due respect to Pete Townshend and his song writing abilities, I think the best who songs in terms of being dark and brooding and all the while still funny were written by John Entwhistle.  (Also, yes... The superhero suit is Monkees inspired.)
 12" Art Rewards (Not in book!)


YA MISSED IT!
 Tiny Pictures of All of the Sleeves In The Sketchbook
