updates.update_userinfo: New Kickstarter! "What I Did Over My 2020 Staycation!"
Pages are final and shipping dates are set!
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone!
I know that I just hit your inbox with those reward surveys, and the last thing I want to do is assail your inbox with duplicate information...  But I got a few questions and figured if a couple people are asking, a  bunch more may be wondering! 
So first off, both "Kenttucky Pussy" and "Sketchbook Picture Sleeves: Volume 1" are at the printer and scheduled to be delivered to me in time to debut them at Cartoon Crossroads Columbus (CXC)  at the Saturday and Sunday expo. (September 28 and 29.)  One of your options for delivery of your reward is to come to this great Columbus show and corner me at the Nix Comics table.  Just shake your fist at me and yell "GIVE ME MY STUFF, MAAAAAAAAAN..."

Hey Everybody!  
It was a bit of a nail-biter, but early yesterday morning we hit goal and I'm happy to say that both of these books will be brought to print!  My hope is to have both ready by the Cartoon Crossroads Columbus (CXC) expo on September 28th and 29th.  Anyone who wants to pick up their rewards there and then should let me know and I'll accommodate ya.  J.T. might even make an appearance if you want to get your copy of "Kenttucky Pussy" signed!  Good lord willing and the creek don't rise, rest of the books will mail out that next Monday.

updates.update_userinfo: New Rewards: Original JT Dockery Art!
updates.update_content:
Hey all!
Got some new (and exciting!!!) rewards up and I wanted to give the folks who have already chipped in a shot at them first, before I let the broader populace know about them!  JT has uncovered some of the art for the originally intended poetry book version of "Kenttucky Pussy" and has generously offered them up as rewards.  I have set each one for $50 (free ship in the U.S.) which includes both new nix publications.  If you want to change yur pledge and grab one of these, just go to the main page for the campaign (link below) and click on the blue button that says "manage your pledge"

updates.update_userinfo: Phew! Week one in the books!
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone!
Thanks to you all for getting me through the first week of this project!  Depending on your familiarity with crowdfunding, you probably now that the first week of a kickstarter is the most explosive in terms of drama for the creator/publisher.  After all of the hard work (and frankly more fun) part of putting a project together, suddenly there is suddenly urgency.  All of the articles I've read about running a  successful kickstarter have a sentence that basically amounts to "99.9% of campaigns that don't reach 50% funded by the end of week 1 ARE DOOMED TO FAILURE and the people running them should go buy a shack in Montana to go ruminate in."  Or something like that.  Point is there is a lot of pressure to be successful week 1.

updates.update_userinfo: 1/3 of the way home! Thanks so much!
updates.update_content: Hey everybody!  Thanks again for helping me bring these two books into being.  You should have all received a thank-you coupon code for use at my mail order site, if you haven't or can't figure out how to enter it, let me know.

updates.update_content:
Hey, just letting everyone know that the final rewards are heading out this week. We have been short a couple of set lists and drum sticks but those shall be sent out in due course. 
While we are grateful for your patience we do have to apologise for the lateness of your rewards. When we started this we had no idea that Andy would have to go for a brain operation midway through the process. This left us without the cash to get some rewards as we were relying on money from gigs to pay for certain aspects of the Kickstarter.

Hey, sorry this has taken a little longer than expected, but the T-shirts are finally here and we can start shipping out the orders. 
We should have most of them shipped out over the next couple of weeks. Everything will be with you by the end of January. Even all those of you outwith the UK. 
Due to the whole Christmas thing I won't have the signed set lists or drum sticks until the first week in January as I forgot to get them off the guys. Sorry about that, but they will be shipped out as soon as I get them.
Just to make you aware that the preorders for the EP will be going live in January. This is to cash in on some of the radio play and good reviews we've been getting. It won't be sent out, or go live on Spotify and the like, until March. We shall be launching it at Bannermans, Edinburgh on the 14th March. Which hasn't been announced yet, but you guys gave us the cash to do this thing so we're gonna tell you first.

Hey, just letting you all know that the CD's are back from the printers and are ready to go. We are just waiting for the badges, stickers and T-shirts to arrive which means we are running later than anticipated. As soon as they are here we will have them sent out to you.
Thank you for your patience
James

Hey guys, just letting you know that if you want your name to appear on the CD then you will have to fill out your survey by the 27th October.
If you haven't filled it in by then, we will have to use your Kickstarter name.
This is so we can get production started on the CD's. 
Thank you

Sorry we've been radio silent for the last few months. My computer took a hissy fit and it's practically impossible to update you from my phone. Anyway, a quick wee update to let you all know that the masters of the EP are back. You will have the digital versions sent to you in the next week or so depending on when you fill out the survey.
It's gonna take a while longer to get the CD's to you as they still need to be made. We just want to get the tracks out to you as soon as possible. The feedback so far has been incredible and we are really looking forward to letting you all hear it.

Hey, first of all, thank you to everyone for pledging to the campaign. Sorry it's taken just over a week to put up the first update but a lot of stuff has happened in that week. I'll bring you all up to date now.
Thanks to you we head into the studio next week with Toby Jepson, thank you. We are currently going through the songs with Toby and figuring out which ones we want to do for this EP and the best way to do them.

As we have rushed past our goal, we have now put up Stretch Goals.
We asked the internet and the two things they seemed to want the most are plectrums and patches.
So... at £1500 all physical backers will receive a She Burns Red plectrum. At £2000 all physical backers will receive a She Burns Red patch.

We are so excited to announce the producer of our upcoming EP is Toby Jepson!
Most people will know him as the front man of Little Angels and Wayward sons but his producer credits include Saxon, The Answer, The Virginmarys and Toseland to name but a few. We really can’t wait to get into the studio! Pre production has already started and we are hoping for it to be out mid to late October. We will also hopefully have our next single and video done by September.

Hey, just a wee word to say thank you to everyone for pledging so far. We are currently sitting with just £140 until we reach our goal. All in one week. Incredible.
We still have some way to go so tell your friends, shout from the rooftops and if you don't have any friends... stop people in the street and tell them about the power of She Burns Red. Or something, just don't get arrested cause we don't have the cash to bail you out.
We are currently working with our producer to make sure we give you the best EP possible. We will be announcing him next week, we're just waiting for the all clear. Then we will bash you in the face with it. We are very excited about working with him and we hope you will be too.

campaign.story:
Cursed to become zombies whenever they play their music, the members of the punk band Toe Tag Riot use their "zombie powers" ethically, only murderizing and eating bigots, homophobes, transphobes, sexists, and racists.  
  Toe Tag Riot formed in the 2000s, devoured and digested scores of Nazi skinheads, sexist dudebros, and even the Westboro Baptist Church (see volume 1 for that tale!), then broke up, to the dismay of their legions of fans.  But now they're back with a reunion tour sure to be even bloodier, funnier and a little more queer than ever before!
  And yes, fan-favorite guest stars Teddy Mercury, and Andy Hurley from Fall Out Boy, are back!
 Return of the Toe Tag Riot is a digital-first 4-issue series, collected to physical trade paperback.
Issues 1-4 covers and the classic punk albums they're homages to. Issue 1 cover by Jonathan Brandon Sawyer and Josh Jensen, others by Sean Von Gorman, Gab Contreras, and Tim Daniel
Pinup by Bobby Timony to be included in issue 1 and the TPB
Matt Miner (GWAR: Orgasmageddon, Lab Raider)
Sean Von Gorman (This Nightmare Kills Fascists, Love is Love)
Gab Contreras (All We Ever Wanted: Stories of a Better World, 2000 AD)
Taylor Esposito (Red Hood and the Outlaws, Fresh Romance)

Kickstarter video features a sample of "EAT YOUR FACE," the new Toe Tag Riot* single that's been burning up the charts ever since the band reunited!

* IRL recorded by TTR's buddy Rene Rosa - full version available along with the band's previous hit "Toe Tag Riot" on the cassette single reward tier.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Let's be real: Kickstarters are a beast, and there are always going to be challenges, but between Matt and Sean, we've run 6 successful Kickstarter projects in the past —so we know where the pitfalls are, we know how to hustle and how to promote, and we feel absolutely confident we can bang this out and make a very very cool book in the process.

There is a great publisher onboard to publish Return of the Toe Tag Riot, as long as we can pay the art and creative costs with the successful Kickstarter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Only 5 days left on DEATH TRAP! Don't miss out!
updates.update_content:
Hey all, I thank anyone who still reads these updates and please know that I love you.  Building a career in comics, when you're an opinionated loudmouth with something to say, is especially tough.  It means I have to reach out to you folks, and sometimes, like today, I have to reach out for maybe the third time?  I'm not sure.
What I do know is that DEATH TRAP is in the home stretch, but we only have 5 days left.  Please check it out?  Please pledge.  I swear to you, this is a beautifully illustrated book with a ton of heart, a lot of bananas fun, and just enough of my point of view that you'll be like "Ah, he snuck that in there, nice."

updates.update_userinfo: Hey TTR 2 backers! I launched a new Kickstarter - DEATH TRAP! It's f'n bananas!
updates.update_content:
Hey backers,
While we wait for the world to be less "nightmare a day" to relaunch Return of the Toe Tag Riot, might I direct you to a new comic project I just launched called DEATH TRAP?  I swear, this is right up your alley, TTR fans, and it's so. damn. much. fun.
And, thanks to everyone who sent well wishes re: my Dad.  He's OK and, in his mid 70s he's decided to get married again.  Life is weird and I guess he realized he's not immortal and he better put a ring on it before it's too late.  :)

updates.update_userinfo: An update, a delay, an explanation and apology - TOE TAG RIOT will be back another time.
updates.update_content:
Friends, 
Matt here.  I want to thank you all for backing this project and believing in the vision - wanting TOE TAG RIOT to return in this new age of awfulness to lay waste to (and make fun of) the absolute scum of the Earth.
But, we're needing to cancel the project for now, and we'll bring it back another time.  Some of you may know, but for those who don't:  My Dad was taken to the hospital about a week and a half ago, and my head has not been in the game for promotion, press, and the like.  I've not been able to focus on much aside from immediate deadlines, my dogs and the rescue, and the overwhelming worry and stress over what's going on with my Dad.

Hello everyone!
First of all, THANK YOU! We are well past the first day of the campaign and we are THRILLED and MOVED with the response from Toe Tag Riot fans who have welcomed us back to bring you more of the same!
Matt and I would like to take a moment to thank all 69 of your reading this. That's right, 69 people have committed their hard earned cash into helping Matt and I make another comic where a Zombie Punk Rock Band eat the worst humanity has to offer. What an fitting milestone to commemorate!

campaign.story:
Cover A and Cover B

What is Crumple
Reporter Martin Elroy is visiting the home of the reclusive scientist couple Simon and Diana Roschler. They've invented a time machine, one that projects moments in time onto the present. But when the machine malfunctions, the family home turns into a shifting death trap where the Roschlers' past regrets are put on display. Can they escape this death trap? Can they escape themselves?
Page 1
Who are we?
Kyle Lawrence -   is the script master for Crumple and has been working at the project for nearly three years. He's also the campaign manager. Kyle's comics have been featured in ComicBookHour's One Comic to Rule Them All, Back From the Depths' Hallowscream 2018 and Oneshi Press' Winter 2018 Anthology. 
 Bo Christian - the colorist and is a former US Air Force Structural journeymen, which means he enlisted to be Bob the Builder instead of GI Joe. However he wasn’t really good at that so he decided to become a comic book writer/artists (which, depending on who you ask, he’s not very good at that either). He has been part of two anthologies; Oneshi Press’s 2018 anthology and Stache Comic’s Everafterward a reddit community based anthology. 
 Mac Radwanski (Artist) is a comic book artist. As a kid, he dreamed about being Batman, or drawing comic books for a living. The latter part worked out. He published such books as "Doc Dino", "Runners", "The Face and the Hand". When not drawing, he likes to play my guitar, or relax with some video games." 
What are we making?
Your pledges go toward the creation of Crumple #1, the first in a three part comic book mini-series about a malfunctioning time machine and the poisonous power of regret. Luckily, the first 8 pages are already finished and are available to read right here!


Page 2
 The Idea
Crumple was born out of a nightmare, of a loved one becoming trapped inside a wall and suffocating. From there the idea was given form on scripted pages and tempered through writes, rewrites and critiques into its current form brought to life by artist and colorist Mac Radwanski and Bo Christian.
Page 3
 Timeline
Once the project is funded, it should take approximately two months for our artists to work their magic. Then the pages go to the printer, and then comes the work of shipping everything out. We plan to have everything arrive during October, a perfectly spooky month for a horror comic.
Page 4
 Budget
Payment for art and lettering: $1200
Printing: $1500
Shipping costs: $1.75 to ship each comic + 50 cents for each envelope) x 500 copies printed = $1,125 
Business cards: $10 for 250 
Total: $3,835
Page 5
 What this means to me 
I came up with the concept for Crumple about 3 years ago and have spent that time doing rewrites and rewrites, gathering talented people to bring the project to life. To me Crumple is a beginning. A future career in comics where I continue to connect with people through stories is possible with just this one project coming to fruition. Help me make this nightmare a reality.

campaign.story:
**STRETCH GOALS!**
$565 - More books printed for sale at Small Press Expo PLUS a bonus page in the PDF to showcase comic scripts for chapter 2.
The Legend of Jamie Roberts is the story of...well, Jamie Roberts: a genderqueer pirate, and their two best friends, Thomas and Daniel. One day, during a pirate raid with the crew of Captain O’Malley, the trio finds an unfinished map. Jamie takes one look at this map and says...
Thus begins Chapter 1 of The Legend of Jamie Roberts. It was a webcomic that updated once a week on Wednesdays, and now Chapter 1 is going to print!
What’s in the print version that the online one won’t have? Well, there will be…
a one-page bonus comic featuring Captain O’Malley (never before published online!)
behind the scenes character sketches
and more features!
Now, The Legend is also on Patreon, and that’s how these comic pages could update online so consistently. Patrons on Patreon who also back this campaign will get an extra mini-comic in their rewards!
“Wait,” you may be saying, “if you have a Patreon, why run a KickStarter campaign?”
Because a) Patreon covers groceries and art supplies, and b) this KickStarter is to cover the stuff that Patreon can’t cover.
So what WILL the KickStarter funding cover? Here’s the breakdown:
$150 for the ISBN and Barcode
$115 for printing, set up fee, and getting the books to me
$100 for shipping to backers
$50 for printing miscellaneous backer rewards
$50 for any surprise costs (international shipping, transfer fees, and other costs would be covered by this)
What rewards are available for backing this project? Those are listed already, but they include:
physical and digital copies of the book
mini-prints
a new 11x17 inch print to hang on your wall
and other goodies!
So if anything fits your budget, I hope you can pledge!
If you’re broke, please share this campaign with your pirate-loving friends. Every share helps.
Thank you for your support!
You. Are. Awesome.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my TENTH KickStarter campaign. I only failed 1 campaign out of those 10, and I learned from that failure these key things: set a reasonable asking goal with a reasonable time frame. I think $465 in 13 days is doable (It's certainly been done in previous campaigns).

Otherwise, I think succeeding 9 times out of 10 can speak for itself. I know how to get rewards done, and I know how to do them quickly.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
